title: How to Beat Nascar 09

steps.headline: Buy an Xbox 360, Playstation 3, or Playstation 2 and NASCAR 2009!
steps.description: You can't play the game without these too.

steps.headline: Click yes to auto saving.
steps.description: It will work as you can save your progress throughout the game.

steps.headline: When Jeff Gordon wants to take you for a test run, say no.
steps.description: Immediately skip to driver info and career mode.

steps.headline: Sign with a Nationwide Series team and sponsor.
steps.description: This sponsor and team should be the lowest on the list of sponsors that you can access because you gain the most reputation and performance points.

steps.headline: Set the race length to 3%, turn tire wear off, turn opponent strength to easy, adaptive strength to on, damage to off, collisions to off, and flag rules to off.
steps.description: This might damage your long-term success, but it will help you gain the reputation you need.

steps.headline: Begin racing!
steps.description: However, with these settings, you should qualify at around 30th, but you must win every single race in order to gain reputation quickly.

steps.headline: Win every race!
steps.description: Seriously. If you win a race by leading a lap, you will get 249 reputation points per race (an added 50 for the Las Vegas race). If you do this, you should be able to sign with a Sprint Cup Series team in just 4 Nationwide Series races.

steps.headline: Sign with Polesitter Motor sports and the lowest sponsor on the accessible list of sponsors, and then you're in the Sprint Cup Series!
Repeat these steps, and watch your reputation go up.
steps.description: By the time you don't gain any more reputation, you should have 1 championship and around 50 wins if you do this properly. So, now you can start increasing the difficulty levels, and start from ones that are worth the least, and then start adding on the difficulty.

text: Buy an Xbox 360, Playstation 3, or Playstation 2 and NASCAR 2009! You can't play the game without these too. Click yes to auto saving. It will work as you can save your progress throughout the game. When Jeff Gordon wants to take you for a test run, say no. Immediately skip to driver info and career mode. Sign with a Nationwide Series team and sponsor. This sponsor and team should be the lowest on the list of sponsors that you can access because you gain the most reputation and performance points. Set the race length to 3%, turn tire wear off, turn opponent strength to easy, adaptive strength to on, damage to off, collisions to off, and flag rules to off. This might damage your long-term success, but it will help you gain the reputation you need. Begin racing! However, with these settings, you should qualify at around 30th, but you must win every single race in order to gain reputation quickly. Win every race! Seriously. If you win a race by leading a lap, you will get 249 reputation points per race (an added 50 for the Las Vegas race). If you do this, you should be able to sign with a Sprint Cup Series team in just 4 Nationwide Series races. Sign with Polesitter Motor sports and the lowest sponsor on the accessible list of sponsors, and then you're in the Sprint Cup Series!  Repeat these steps, and watch your reputation go up. By the time you don't gain any more reputation, you should have 1 championship and around 50 wins if you do this properly. So, now you can start increasing the difficulty levels, and start from ones that are worth the least, and then start adding on the difficulty.
